intro: Altamiranoa levis, commonly known as the smoothleaf altamiranoa, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
